item.title: Pepsi shares jump 4% as activist Elliott takes $4 billion stake, sees 'historic' value opportunity
item.description: The Paul Singer-founded Elliott's bet in Pepsi is worth $4 billion, becoming the consumer giant's top five active investors excluding index funds.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest premarket moves: Kraft Heinz, PepsiCo, Biogen, Signet Jewelers and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in the premarket.

item.title: Pickleball is just getting started in China
item.description: Online sales of pickleball paddles and related equipment in China have skyrocketed, according to data from WPIC Marketing + Technologies.

item.title: China's Xi urges AI cooperation, rejects ‘Cold War mentality’ at SCO summit

item.title: Here's what it really means for Trump to get control of the Federal Reserve board
item.description: Since taking office in January, Trump has placed the Fed directly in the crosshairs of executive power.
